intro: Anagallidium dimorphum, commonly known as the two-form filaree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and gravelly soils. It produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring, followed by slender, elongated seed pods. Anagallidium dimorphum is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient environments.
